result.execSummary:
The defendant James Basley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

03:20 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant James Basley in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Atty. Nimmer confirms her client is prepared to proceed with plea and sentencing today.  Court notes the State has filed an amended information.  Atty. Nimmer acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters initial not guilty plea.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Nimmer confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 in the Amended Inforamtion, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Att. Nimmer.


COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

30 Days Jail Straight Time (Credit - 114 Days) - TIME SERVED.

FINE or COSTS: Waived by the Court.
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Court to apply the remaining days credit - PAID IN FULL.
Amended Information filed by the State.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:38 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant James Basley in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Nimmer advises there is an offer, she is just waiting for a decision on defendant's revocation.  Atty. Nimmer is requesting a plea and sentencing in about 2 weeks.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on April 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
